Posts.Content: My husband had robotic prostatectomy on Nov 7, 2017. The cancer had went outside of the prostate so the Seminole Vesicle was removed along with the lymph nodes. Pathology shows the left vesicle was cancerous as well as 1 lymph node out of 3 and 32% of the prostate. Path also scored him as a Gleason 9. Recovery is going pretty good after 3 days of fighting the results of the CO2. He biggest problem is his penis and scrotum are so swollen and painful. Does anyone know how long this will last.
Posts.Title: Swollen Penis and scrotum

Posts.Content: John 4803, hubby doing good. It was 3 weeks this past Tuesday since his surgery. He had his catheter removed a week after the surgery. He still has some swelling in the abdomen but it has went down considerably. His scrotum and penis are still swollen. They both go down some at night but go back up after he gets up. He reclines most of the time which helps some but according to him not enough! He did finally put some jeans on this week which he said did help as far as support but he still is in the waddling state when he walks. He has been outside walking more this week which I think helped some. After reading about everyone else having the same problems it helps relieve the anxiety which also helps. He said it it wasn’t for the boys being three times their size he would be in great shape considering. He is also a pT3b, GS 9 with one positive lymph node. Incontinence is not bad. Dry at night and mostly during the day except when getting up, sneezing etc. Has already switched from wearing the guard pads to the lighter pad which I feel is pretty good. Go back for his first PSA and follow up since surgery on 1-3-18. Hoping for a good read but prepared for probable radiation treatments. How long did you have to have the catheter. How are you doing with treatments?
